intro: Boophone ciliaris, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms. Boophone ciliaris is adapted to dry conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
